sub_title: Deep level learning and teaching, enrichment, gifted education
summary:
I am an educational psychologist with a research background in learning styles and strategies, deep level approaches to teaching and learning, and levels of learning outcome. I have considerable experience in curriculum development, especially regarding the needs of gifted children. My interests are in creative and divergent thinking, and in developing materials to promote an intrinsic motivation to learning by exploring and connecting ideas. I grew up in the  international environment of Hong Kong and have both personal and professional experience of many different cultures and educational systems. My university studies and PhD were completed in the UK. I then lived in Israel and the United States before moving to the Netherlands where I have mainly worked in establishing gifted programs in primary schools and in teacher training. I continue to develop materials which motivate children and teachers to take a deeper and broader interest in what they learn, at the same time increasing their skill and general awareness of how to learn. I give workshops and seminars to teachers at primary and secondary levels as well as presentations to other educational professionals.
I speak Dutch and English fluently and make materials in both languages.

education.field_of_study: Psychology of Learning, deep level approaches and outcomes, text effects

profile_positions.description: Currently developing materials and projects for schools, based on my research background in deep level attitudes to learning. I have a lot of experience working with gifted children and their teachers in various settings and age-groups, working with Dutch as well as international schools. I design and develop multi-disciplinary projects with extra range and challenge for bright and gifted children as well as making stimulating enrichment projects for mixed ability groups. I work in Dutch or English and also give workshops to teachers at both primary and secondary schools to explain and support my approach and its foundation in educational research.
profile_positions.title: Educational Projects: Design and Development

profile_positions.description: conceived a new approach to curriculum presentation using visual maps of thematic content to motivate  kids and teachers to see the whole picture. Developed a series of themes and content maps for gifted education within this curriculum, and led small teams of subject specialists to develop accompanying teacher manuals, teacher training, and class activities.
profile_positions.title: Head of Research and Development

profile_positions.description: Developed many multi-disciplinary enrichment projects in poster form with a strong visual element and topic overview. Taught a wide range of these topics to children in mixed ability as well as separate gifted groups. Developed method of asking deep level questions and suggesting class activities and teaching approaches to stimulate deep level attitudes to learning in children. Developed and presented workshops for teachers to introduce the notions of deep and surface level approaches to learning and to explore the significance of these approaches and how they can be influenced.
profile_positions.title: Enrichment and Gifted Education

profile_positions.description: Worked primarily in the English as a foreign language team developing materials for high school and middle school students learning English. Developed the series "Focus" which used a novel approach to teaching reading comprehension by making various general learning strategies explicit to both students and language teachers. This increased awareness of reading for the main idea, for details, for event sequences, for conclusions or evidence, etc. was useful to students' progress and satisfaction in learning English as well as to their general studies.
profile_positions.title: Curriculum Developer
